section.docs:
The pipeline models the progression of a contact. They enter the system as a `lead` and either exit the system as a `customer` or a `dead end`. You do not have to manage the pipeline yourself. It happens automatically based a user's interaction with that particular person. The progression through the pipeline is:
1. Lead 2. Prospect 3. Opportunity 4. Customer 5. Dead End
These states are not serial. They can be skipped. Radium will do it's best to adapt to all scenarios. Contacts can have their state changed if people desire. However, the automatically pipeline progression should be acceptable in most scenarios.

section.title: Leads
section.docs: `Lead` is the default state. If a contact is added **without** a state specified they will be a lead. A lead is someone you have not contacted or interacted with. A lead represents a chance for your company to make money. A lead will become a prospect once they are interacted with. This means, sending them a message, inviting them to a meeting, or making a todo about them. They can become a dead end if they are uninterested in whatever your product is. All states can become dead ends at any time.

section.title: Prospecs
section.docs: `Prospect` means you've interacted with this contact some how. They've already been through the lead pool and you're are actively trying to start a deal with this person in some fashion. A prospect will become an `opportunity` when a deal is added with them.

section.title: Opportunities
section.docs: `Opportunity` means there is open deal with this person. They will either become a customer when the deal is paid or dead end if the deal is rejected.

section.title: Customers
section.docs: `Customer` is the happy state. This means they've bought whatever your selling and now it is up to you to follow up with them or do whatever your organization requires to retain them.

section.title: Dead Ends
section.docs: `Dead Ends` are people who are not interested in your product(s) at all. They should not be contacted again. For all intensive purposes, you can consider them removed from the system.

section.title: Statistics & Reports
section.docs: Progression through the pipeline is automatically tracked by Radium. Radium will use this information to generate all sorts of fancy reports (including charts and graphs!) for pipeline states at arbitrary times. We are here for all your enterprise needs! (including charts and graphs).
